title: How Does the Naivedya Become Prasadam? | Sri Satya Gaura Chandra Dasa | ISKCON Bangalore Sanga
speaker: HG Satya Gaura Chandra Dasa

segments.key_quote: When you go in front of the Lord, the Lord is watching us, He is hearing our prayers, He is accepting our Naivedya, He is giving back Prasad and He is blessing the devotees, all interactions are going.
segments.summary: The speaker describes the interaction between the devotee and the Lord, emphasizing that the Lord watches, hears, accepts offerings, gives Prasad, and blesses.

segments.key_quote: Love means there should be give and take.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that love requires give and take, and this principle applies to developing love for the Supreme Personality of Godhead.

segments.key_quote: So Krishna says, Asnami, I will accept, He will say.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the process of offering food to Krishna, stating that Krishna accepts the offering.

segments.key_quote: It is said that even if the Lord glances on the food, that turns into Prasadam.
segments.summary: The speaker addresses the atheistic viewpoint regarding offering food to God and explains that God's acceptance is not like human eating; even a glance from the Lord transforms the food into Prasadam.
